definition: to hang or suspend (from a hook etc)/to hang up (the phone)/(of a line) to be dead/to be worried or concerned/to make a phone call (dialect)/to register or record/classifier for sets or clusters of objects/(slang) to kill/to die/to be finished/to fail (an exam)
clock/o'clock/time as measured in hours and minutes/bell/CL:架[jia4],座[zuo4]
handleless cup/goblet/to concentrate/variant of 鐘|钟[zhong1]

sentences.english: The walls were bare except for a clock.
sentences.chinese: 墙上除了一只挂钟什么也没有。

sentences.english: The wall clock read one minute after midnight.
sentences.chinese: 墙上的挂钟走到了午夜后一分钟的地方。

sentences.english: Unusual wall clock made out of recycled magnetic tape reel.
sentences.chinese: 用回收的磁带卷做成的与众不同的挂钟。

sentences.english: Help me to straighten the wall clock.
He became aware of the deep silence of the room; there was only the steady ticking of the wall clock's pendulum.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得房间里静极了，只有挂钟的大摆在嚓嚓地响。

sentences.english: A wall clock will tell you the time of day but not its manufactured brethren.
sentences.chinese: 墙上的挂钟能告诉你时间，它的机器哥儿们却不能。

sentences.english: This is a Care Bear quartz wall clock .
sentences.chinese: 这是一个负照顾石英挂钟。

sentences.english: She slowly arrange down again, inclined Ni the walls clock on the afterward wall, 12:30.
sentences.chinese: 她慢慢又躺了下来，斜睨了下墙上的挂钟，十二点半。

sentences.english: He raised his eyes and met the stare of a bilious clock.
sentences.chinese: 他抬起双眼，跟那座逼视着的挂钟打了个照面。
